name: Hinter-Ridge Settlements
culture_adjustments: Highland Cant primary; Riveric Dialects secondary
strong clan land-tenure and kin arbitration over formal contracts
ancestor-feasts anchored to ridge landmarks and cists
barter, tolls and familiarity-based deals replace strict tariff routines
labor organized around seasonal transhumance and kiln cycles
constraints: ritual-reagent exports subject to state levies
notes: supplies kiln reagents crucial to ritual magic economy
hosts tolls and small markets serving river caravans
seasonal workforce export to lowland saltworks and shipyards
